main event: On July 5, 1949, in Alexandria, Louisiana, a civilian observed a light-colored object with a luminous center, estimated to be the size of an automobile wheel, at an altitude of approximately 2000 feet. The object appeared to be round, flat on the edges, and thick in the center, and it disappeared behind trees and a building.
interesting points: The object was described as light in color with a luminous center of bright yellow, and its shape was compared to that of an automobile wheel.
It traveled in a northeastern direction and was observed for approximately 30 seconds at an altitude of about 2000 feet.
No physical evidence, exhaust, or impact on clouds was observed, and there was no sound or odor associated with the object.
The observer, Mrs. [Redacted], was described by a neighbor as a woman of excellent character and not known to exaggerate.
The Office of Special Investigations decided not to conduct further investigation into the sighting.
sighted object: light-colored object with a luminous center, estimated size of an automobile wheel
